intro: Centaurea gulissashvilii, commonly known as the Georgian knapweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Georgia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust stem structure. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are bright yellow with a red or purple center, forming a composite inflorescence that attracts pollinators. Centaurea gulissashvilii is adapted to rocky and dry habitats, showcasing its resilience in harsh environments.
